Class Bin

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Bin

  • public class Bin
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to describe a Bin object.
    Author:
    Moises Baly

      • findWhereToPlace

        private int findWhereToPlace(MArea piece,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double> freeRectangles)
        Finds in which free rectangular space the specified piece can be placed. Method called from boundingBoxPacking(geometricprimitives.MArea[])
        Parameters:
        piece - piece to place inside an empty rectangular space.
        freeRectangles - list of empty rectangular spaces.
        Returns:
        • -1 if not valid position was found.
        • position where the piece can be placed, otherwise.

      • eliminateNonMaximal

        private void eliminateNonMaximal()

      • moveAndReplace

        private boolean moveAndReplace(int indexLimit)
        Second strategy applied to bounding box methods: try to place already placed pieces inside other placed pieces. Method called from BBCompleteStrategy(geometricprimitives.MArea[])
        Parameters:
        indexLimit - lower left limit when applying this strategy.
        Returns:
        • true if some piece changed its position, that is, if was placed inside other.
        • false otherwise.

      • sweep

        private MArea sweep(MArea container,
                    MArea inside,
                    MArea collisionArea)
        Sweeps a piece along the interior of a container searching for a non-overlapping position. Method called from moveAndReplace(int)
        Parameters:
        container - container that contains the piece to sweep.
        inside - piece to place inside the container.
        collisionArea - areas that cannot intersect with the new piece.
        Returns:
        • null if not valid position was found.
        • MArea new MArea placed in the valid position.

      • compress

        public void compress()
        Compress all placed pieces in this bin towards the lower left corner(in the Java Coordinate System).

      • compress

        private boolean compress(MArea collisionArea,
                         MArea compressArea,
                         java.awt.Rectangle container,
                         MVector vector)
        Compress a piece towards the lower left corner(in the Java Coordinate System) of a container, avoiding collision with other pieces placed inside the container. Method called from compress()
        Parameters:
        collisionArea - other pieces inside the container.
        compressArea - area to compress.
        container - container inside which the piece needs to be compressed.
        vector - direction and sense of the compression.
        Returns:
        • true if the piece moved, was compressed.
        • false otherwise.

      • dropPieces

        public MArea[] dropPieces(MArea[] notPlaced)
        Drops pieces from the top of the bin (Java Coordinate System) to find a valid, not occupied position.
        Parameters:
        notPlaced - pieces to be placed inside the bin.
        Returns:
        pieces that could not be placed inside the bin.

      • dive

        private MArea dive(MArea toDive,
                   java.awt.Rectangle container,
                   MArea collisionArea,
                   MVector vector)
        Moves a piece towards the bottom of the bin (Java Coordinate System). Gravity simulation. Method called from dropPieces(geometricprimitives.MArea[])
        Parameters:
        toDive - area to move in the direction of the vector.
        container - container in which to place the piece.
        collisionArea - MArea that contains positions to be avoided when moving the piece.
        vector - containing the information for the movement.
        Returns:
        • null if not valid position was found.
        • MArea a new MArea in the valid position found.
